result.execSummary:
The defendant Crystal L Steiner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Substance Abuse Program.
May be transferred to Texas through Interstate Compact Transfer

miscConds.notes: Restitution in the amount of $12,705.30 to be paid as follows: As a Condition of Probation. $5,000.00 to DNR and $7,705.30 to Liberty Mutual.

Court costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.

No contact with any employees of the DNR office.
No employment in capacity with fiduciary responsibility.
Provide DNA sample if not already done.
DNA surcharge IS WAIVED.
Case 14CF1056 was dismissed and read into: 14CF223.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time - (nonworking hours-Huber) FORTHWITH. Standard release conditions. Sentence may be served in Texas. NO ELECTRONIC MONITORING.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Crystal L Steiner in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties proceed to sentencing on Ct. 1. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Total sentence: 4 years (Initial Confinement: 2 years, Extended Supervision: 2 years)  Stayed for 5 years Probation - may be transferred to Texas through Interstate Compact transfer
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
- Court Costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- Restitution of $12,705.03; $5000.00 to be paid to DNR and $7,705.30 to be paid to Liberty Mutual to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
- Conditions of  Probation: Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.  No contact with employees of the DNR. No employment in capacity with fiduciary responsibility.  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided.  DNA surcharge is waived. 
 - 10 months jail with huber Condition Time (nonworking hours) commencing FORTHWITH.  Non-working hours with standard release conditions. Sentence may be served in Texas. Court orders NO electronic monitoring. 
Defendant remanded to the custody of the sheriff forthwith.
